instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> seriously damaged
threads.message:
This board looks like someone plugged a USB killer into it... Probably not but here is the list of failures.

L4605 burned cracked chared PCB. - REMOVED
<CHIP>U4600</CHIP> has a hole in it - REMOVED
<CHIP>U6410</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6440</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6430</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6420</CHIP> all shorted - REMOVED
<CHIP>U8080</CHIP> shorted - REPLACED
<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> fucked - REPLACED
<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> had some crap on it - REPLACED just because
<CHIP>U7700</CHIP> - REPLACED
Screen not detected, obvi no backlight. External monitor does come to life and shows boot screen but turns off half way through boot. I guess it's turning off when it gets to desktop.
Unable to test keyboad and trackpad.

<CHIP>U8300</CHIP> - REPLACED

Restoring the screen functionaliy is the next job.

OK screen is now working too.

Next job is to get the audio back up and running.

The fault looks to have originated from <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>..... Would anyone care to take a stab at a possible cause?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> seriously damaged
threads.message: Ive seen this before, Came with a Extremely burnt USB port. I also thought it could be a USB killer. Every time i removed one short resistance would go up a couple of ohms and id have to search for another. Well done for getting it running though!
